SENT.plain: Patients with lesions to the right parietal lobe were tested on their ability to reach to targets, or to respond verbally to targets
The targets occurred at the same two spatial locations--to the left and right of the patient--with the task being cued by the color of the target
Patients were able to perform both tasks separately rapidly and without error
However, when the two tasks were interleaved, they had difficulty making a response in the left (contralesional) field when this was different to a response that they had just made
These results suggest that lesions to the parietal cortex may cause a deficit in the coding for motor intention, as well as attention in the contralesional field
